meanings.definition: To bring back to a former or original condition
meanings.sent1: I will restore this old painting to its original beauty.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will restore the broken chair to its former glory.
meanings.sent3: After the clumsy cat knocked it over, I had to restore the vase to its former self.
meanings.sent4: The sun's warmth helped restore life to the frozen land.
meanings.sent5: With great care, she managed to restore the delicate antique clock to working order.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic will restore the classic car to its former splendor.
meanings.sent2: They plan to restore the old house and make it beautiful again.
meanings.sent3: I had to restore my favorite shoes after the sole came loose.
meanings.sent4: The tailor worked tirelessly to restore the torn dress to perfection.
meanings.sent5: Using new materials, they were able to restore the roof of the house to its original state.

meanings.definition: To return something to its rightful owner
meanings.sent1: The police were able to restore the stolen jewelry to its owner.
meanings.sent2: The lost dog was restored to its grateful family.
meanings.sent3: I had to restore the borrowed book to its rightful place on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The kind stranger helped restore the lost wallet to its owner.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunter was thrilled to restore the ancient artifact to the museum.

meanings.definition: To give back or return something to its previous state
meanings.sent1: The software update will restore the computer to its previous settings.
meanings.sent2: He hoped the medicine would restore his health to what it was before.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion promised to restore the frog to its former prince self.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped restore the dry soil to its previous moisture level.
meanings.sent5: The artist worked hard to restore the faded painting to its original vibrancy.
